intro: Heritiera vespertilio, commonly known as the evening heritiera, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the late afternoon, giving it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while the fruits are capsule-like and release seeds when mature.
